allData.occupation: Doctoral Researcher bei QUT (Queensland University of Technology)

positions.title: Doctoral Researcher
positions.description:
Development of translational 3D in vitro models for breast cancer research.

The tissue microenvironment is crucial for many pathological processes such as breast cancer. My project aims to develop a tissue-specific 3D cancer model mimicking the mammary tissue environment, which is important in cancer cell behaviour and drug response. Overcoming limitations of conventional 2D cell culture techniques, our approach using a semi-synthetic biomaterial to reconstruct the matrix in our 3D cultures reflect closer cell-cell and cell-matrix interactions involved in breast cancer in situ.

positions.title: Visiting Research Scientist
positions.description:
3 weeks research visit during the PhD program, funded by the German Academic Exchange Service (DAAD)

Project: Investigation of the potential to culture circulating breast tumour cells in hydrogels.

Supervisor: Prof H. Neubauer, Dr L. Bray
positions.companyName: Neubauer Lab, University Medical Centre D端sseldorf

positions.title: Practical Training
positions.description:
Lab rotation during Master program at CRTD, TU Dresden.

Project: The role of DKK-1 deletion in the pathogenesis of serum-induced arthritis in a mouse model.

Methods: animal handling, Genotyping, PCR, histological and molecular analysis, micro-CT

Supervisor: Prof L. Hofbauer, Dr. M. Rauner, Dr. S. Thiele

Outcome:
Poster presentation: CRTD Summer Conference on Regenerative Medicine 2016, Dresden Germany

positions.title: Practical Training
positions.description:
Lab rotation during Master program at CRTD, TU Dresden.

Project: Effect of high salt diet on human macrophages.

Methods: in vitro cell culture, blood cell isolation, FACS

Supervisor: Prof. Markus Kleinewietfeld
positions.companyName: Kleinewiefeld Lab, University Medical Centre Carl-Gustav-Carus

positions.title: Practical Training
positions.description:
Lab rotation during Master course at CRTD, TU Dresden.
Project: Study of the regenerative capability of alginate hydrogel implants in spinal cord lesion of rats

Methods: analysis by label-free microscopy (CARS), histological analysis

Supervisor: Prof M. Kirsch, Dr. O. Uckermann

Outcome:
Advanced Microscopy Techniques IV; and Neurophotonics II 95360Y, 2015, DOI: 10.1117/12.2183165
Journal of Biomedical Optics 21(6), 2016, DOI: 10.1117/1.jbo.21.6.061008
Scientific Reports 8, 2018, DOI: 10.1038/s41598-018-29140-z
positions.companyName: Kirsch Lab, University Medical Centre Carl-Gustav-Carus

educations.schoolName: QUT Institute of Health and Biomedical Innovation

educations.fieldOfStudy: International Degree in Regenerative Biology and Medicine
educations.schoolName: DFG Center for Regenerative Therapies / TU Dresden

educations.fieldOfStudy: International Degree in Industrial and Environmental Biology
